actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, International Trade Commission, Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, Treasury Department, State Department.

official_title: A bill to deny most-favored-nation status to any country that in the judgment of the President denies religious freedom to its citizens.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Declares that products from any nonmarket economy country shall not be eligible for most-favored nation treatment and that no such country shall participate in Federal programs extending credits or guarantees or be party to a commercial treaty with the United States during any period which the President determines that such country denies its citizens religious freedom.

titles.title: A bill to deny most-favored-nation status to any country that in the judgment of the President denies religious freedom to its citizens.
